department.dept_long_name: Department of Romance Languages and Literatures

course.title: Heroes, Rogues, Lovers, Rebels, Saints: Voices from Medieval and Early Modern Spain
course.faculty_text: Mary M. Gaylord and members of the Department
course.description: Who are the Cid, Lazarillo, Rosaura and Segismundo? As we explore the texts and historical contexts that produced iconic figures like the matamoros, the sentimental Moor, the picaro, the soldier-poet, the mystic, the rebellious vassal and the cross-dressed woman, we bring their voices to life through dramatic reading and performance.
course.prerequisites: A score above 780 on the SAT II or the Harvard Placement test; a 40-, 50-, or 60-level course in Spanish; or permission of course head.
course.notes: Conducted in Spanish. This course includes student art-making as part of the Harvard Arts Initiative.
